definition: to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Here are two boys wrestling down at the bottom of the frame, beautifully composed.
sentences.chinese: 在画面下方有两名正在摔角的男孩，构图很美。

sentences.english: Some of the women even take on their male counterparts.
sentences.chinese: 有些女性摔角手甚至还在比赛中与男性选手较量。

sentences.english: Do you know what it is to wrestle with a madwoman?
sentences.chinese: 你可知道，跟一个疯女人摔角是怎么一回事吗？

sentences.english: The wrestler succeeded in throwing his opponent to the canvas.
sentences.chinese: 那摔角手把对方摔倒在地了。

sentences.english: Everything is in your Hands now to create YOUR dream wrestler .
sentences.chinese: 一切都在你手中现在创建您的梦想摔角手。

sentences.english: One day while in town, Nacho sees a champion professional wrestler on the street.
sentences.chinese: 某日在城里，奈奇在街上看到一位职业摔角冠军。

sentences.english: Hey, look at Sundance wrestle his duck.
sentences.chinese: 你看阿亮在跟鸭子玩摔角。

sentences.english: Was it fun filming the scene where you participate in the Turkish Oil Wrestling?
sentences.chinese: 妳参与的那场土耳其油泥摔角戏好玩吗？
摔角运动员摔倒了他的对手。

sentences.english: Using techniques from wrestling or judo such as throwing or submission techniques.
sentences.chinese: 以摔角或诱导技术进行摔投或制服。

definition: acrobatic fighting in Chinese opera or dance

military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
